In this episode, the boy he goes home with is called Lee. This may explain why Zuko hesitates when Gansu asks his name instead of using the fake name he came up with earlier and will use again later.QuotesUrsa: Zuko, please, my love, listen to me. Everything I've done, I've done to protect you. Remember this, Zuko. No matter how things may seem to change, never forget who you are.ConnectionsFeatured in The Nostalgia Critic: Top 11 Best Avatars (2014)User reviews12ReviewReviewFeatured review10/10 One of my favorite episodesAvatar is one of my favorite shows, containing unparallelled maturity, humor, dealing with heavy subjects, and containing severalof the best character archs ever written.This episode is more of a standalone one off about Zuko drifting through a rural earth kingdom village (It's very reminiscent of old westerns).Zuko's interactions with common people and the reveal of his childhood/relationship with his mother was heartbreaking and explains alot. He's such a complex and interesting character, the voice acting and writing is excellent.Everything is perfect and ends about as tragically as you'd expect.helpful•721irishboy141Apr 16, 2020Top picksSign in to rate and Watchlist for personalized recommendationsSign inDetailsEditRelease dateMay 12, 2006 (United States)LanguageEnglishSee more company credits at IMDbProTechnical specsEditRuntime25 minutesRelated newsContribute to this pageSuggest an edit or add missing contentIMDb Answers: Help fill gaps in our dataLearn more about contributingEdit pageMore to explorePhotosTop Stars to Watch in 2024See the galleryPhotosThe Greatest Character Actors of All TimeSee the galleryListJames' 5 Picks for JanuarySee the full listRecently viewedYou have no recently viewed pagesGet the IMDb AppSign in for more accessSign in for more accessGet the IMDb AppHelpSite IndexIMDbProBox Office MojoIMDb DeveloperPress RoomAdvertisingJobsConditions of UsePrivacy PolicyYour Ads Privacy ChoicesIMDb, an Amazon company© 1990-2024 by IMDb.com, Inc.Back to top

Avatar: The Last Airbender - 10 Things You Missed In Zuko Alone
By
Winston Wallace
Published Jul 13, 2020
CBR VIDEO OF THE DAY
SCROLL TO CONTINUE WITH CONTENT
10 Azula Has Always Bullied Her Friends
9 It's Revealed Why Iroh Didn’t Become Fire Lord
8 There Is Foreshadowing Between The Relationship Of Azula And Her Mother
7 Zuko’s False Name Is The Same As The Boy He Meets In The Episode
6 This Is The First Time Ursa is Revealed
5 This Episode Is Based Around A Western
4 The Dagger Zuko Gives Lee Is Foreshadowed In A Previous Episode
3 The Origin Of Azula’s Name
2 The Pregnant Woman And Her Husband Are Seen In This Episode
1 Ursa’s Quote Comes To Fruition
“If you mess with a mother babies, they're going to bite you back,” is what Ursa laments to Zuko, after being bit by the turtle ducks. Later in the episode, Ursa wakes Zuko up and expresses to Zuko everything she has done was to protect him. She is never seen again. In “The Day of Black Sun: Eclipse: Part 2,” Ozai reveals to Zuko the mystery behind his mother's disappearance. He tells him she was banished because of treason for assisting in killing Fire LordAzulon and keeping Ozai from ending his son's life.
